review: I LOVED this thing from the start, and bought a couple of apps the first day, then I ordered another one for my family and a couple more remotes, I thought it was THAT great (my kid loved it).But on day 2 I saw a message I had not seen on a computer since the late 90's, "out of memory" (I had 5 apps on it total). At this point I was like, "hmmmmm, that's interesting," and figuring there must be a way to plug in a USB and make it work as added memory (it has a USB Port) I called support; turns out you can't.Is not the point of this device for me to consume Amazon content? Why, Amazon, are you making me choose between what games I can keep active? Why not offer a higher memory model, or, much, much better: let me store my stuff on a USB without having to root my Fire TV?It just makes no sense, no sense at all to stop me from buying content the way you just did, no sense at all!

review: The Fire is a nice streamer for people with Amazon accounts. The device is easy to setup and hook up.The most difficult part is putting in your wifi password which is usually on your router and necessary for almost any device you buy anymore.We had ours up and running in 15 minutes . The voice recognition search feature works pretty well most of the time,mostly for simple title searches.I find it more convenient to type in category searches to make the searches more specific such as different holiday movies.  The device understands me alot better than my Garmin does. What I like about this is that it has less clutter than my Roku does with less unusable channels.The Amazon content is easy to get to. The games are pretty nice too,especially the kids love the Disney game.My roku didnt really have any games that I was aware of
